snippet: Among the most contentious issues during the talks in Geneva have been the fate of a reactor in Iran, the country’s stockpile of uranium and how much relief to give it from punishing sanctions.
abstract: Officials in Geneva are still wrestling with details of landmark nuclear agreement with Iran days before visit by Sec of State John Kerry and other Western officials; among most contentious issues are fate of reactor in Iran, country's stockpile of uranium and how much relief to give Iran from punishing economic sanctions.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and MARK LANDLER

lead_paragraph: Among the most contentious issues during the talks in Geneva have been the fate of a reactor in Iran, the country’s stockpile of uranium and how much relief to give it from punishing sanctions.

headline.main: Roadblocks Remain as Officials Work Toward Iranian Nuclear Pact
headline.print_headline: Roadblocks Remain as Western Officials Work Toward Iranian Nuclear Pact
